artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Masadaya Heikichi; Carver: Shimada Tomekichi
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 280.12; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 80, p. 284.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: one sheet; man with a knife in his mouth, with bare lower body, wearing open floral patterned kimono, clinging onto the back of a giant swimming red fish
markings: Carver’s seal: 彫工留吉 {horikō Tomekichi}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Essays by Yoshitoshi (Ikkai zuihitsu 一魁随筆)
signed: 一魁斎芳年筆 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi hitsu}
title: Saitō no Oniwakamaru
